intro: Thesium kilimandscharicum f. erectum, commonly known as the upright thesium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and dense, spiky foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in montane grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
